author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quote: Not all who wander are lost.

author: St. Augustine
quote: The world is a book and those who don’t travel read only one page.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: The journey of 1,000 miles begins with a single step.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Though we travel the world to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us, or we find it not.

author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: Travel makes one modest. You see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: There are no foreign lands. It is the traveler only who is foreign.

author: Pat Conroy
quote: Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends but is played out over and over again in the quietest chambers. The mind can never break off from the journey.

author: St Augustine
quote: The world is a book, and those who don’t travel only read one page.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: Once a year, go someplace you’ve never been before.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
quote: The world is a book and those who don’t travel read only one page.

author: Ibn Battuta
quote: Traveling – it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Live without excuses, travel without regret

author: Andre Gide
quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.

author: Sandra Lake
quote: With age, comes wisdom. With travel, comes understanding.

author: T.S. Eliot
quote: Only those who risk going too far can find out how far one can go.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Not till we are lost do we begin to find ourselves.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: Your true traveler finds boredom rather agreeable than painful. It is the symbol of his liberty-his excessive freedom. He accepts his boredom, when it comes, not merely philosophically, but almost with pleasure.

author: Bill Bryson
quote: To my mind, the greatest reward and luxury of travel is to be able to experience everyday things as if for the first time, to be in a position in which almost nothing is so familiar it is taken for granted.

author: D. H. Lawrence
quote: When we get out of the glass bottle of our ego and when we escape like the squirrels in the cage of our personality and get into the forest again, we shall shiver with cold and fright. But things will happen to us so that we don’t know ourselves. Cool, unlying life will rush in.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Like all great travelers, I have seen more than I remember, and remember more than I have seen.

author: Clifton Fadiman
quote: When you travel, remember that a foreign country is not designed to make you comfortable. It is designed to make its own people comfortable.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine, it is lethal.

author: Henry Miller
quote: One’s destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things.

author: Charles Dudley Warner
quote: A journey is best measured in friends, rather than miles.

author: Martin Buber
quote: All journeys have secret destinations of which the traveler is unaware.

author: Carlo Goldoni
quote: A wise traveler never despises his own country.

author: Mark Twain
quote: I have found out that there ain’t no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them.

author: Cesare Pavese
quote: Traveling is a brutality. It forces you to trust strangers and to lose sight of all that familiar comfort of home and friends. You are constantly off balance. Nothing is yours except the essential things – air, sleep, dreams, the sea, the sky – all things tending towards the eternal or what we imagine of it.

author: Lillian Smith
quote: I soon realized that no journey carries one far unless, as it extends into the world around us, it goes an equal distance into the world within.

author: Jawaharial Nehru
quote: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.

author: Mark Twain
quote: I have found out that there ain’t no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them.

author: Cesare Pavese
quote: Traveling is a brutality. It forces you to trust strangers and to lose sight of all that familiar comfort of home and friends. You are constantly off balance. Nothing is yours except the essential things – air, sleep, dreams, the sea, the sky – all things tending towards the eternal or what we imagine of it.

author: Lillian Smith
quote: I soon realized that no journey carries one far unless, as it extends into the world around us, it goes an equal distance into the world within.

author: Jawaharial Nehru
quote: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.

author: Rudyard Kipling
quote: The first condition of understanding a foreign country is to smell it.

author: Charles Dudley Warner
quote: There is no moment of delight in any pilgrimage like the beginning of it.

author: Pat Conroy
quote: Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends, but is played out over and over again in the quiestest chambers. The mind can never break off from the journey.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: The use of traveling is to regulate imagination by reality, and instead of thinking how things may be, to see them as they are.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.

author: Paul Theroux
quote: Tourists don’t know where they’ve been, travelers don’t know where they’re going.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.

author: Neale Donald Walsch
quote: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.

author: Chief Seattle
quote: Take only memories, leave only footprints.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: There are no foreign lands. It is the traveler only who is foreign.

author: Freya Stark
quote: Travel does what good novelists also do to the life of everyday, placing it like a picture in a frame or a gem in its setting, so that the intrinsic qualities are made more clear. Travel does this with the very stuff that everyday life is made of, giving to it the sharp contour and meaning of art.
